creator: mozilla98

title: Unresponsive with long operations
content: When scanning headers and/or reading messages there are long delays with OS pop up saying Thunderbird is unresponsive. It typically happens when downloads and copying are occurring in the background. TB seems to be giving too much priority to the background making everything in the foreground slow and frequently stop completely. When composing a message a typed line does not appear for 20 seconds or more making it difficult to prevent typing errors. I have not had this problem with older versions of TB. My local message store is well over 20 GB. I expect some operations to take awhile but none should slow or stop response to immediate entry. When TB logs into servers and there are network problems input at the keyboard is often ignored completely. To regain control I have to call the task manager and do end process and restart TB. At first I thought this was a problem with one computer. I have several with a mix of several versions of Windows (7,8,10 and 11) with several email addresses and have the same problem in varying degrees with all of them. If this is a setting problem I have no clue how to fix. I have been using TB more than a decade and feel confident about how to do most operations. I'm using version 140.3.0esr (64bit).
creator: IKBadger

title: Can't re-install email account
content:
I am currently using Thunderbird v 140.3.0esr.

I had recently started getting a pop up message for my yahoo a/c. The message goes ' Enter credentials for email on imap.mail.yahoo.com' and below it was a message 'too many attempts' it does not let me enter any information. If I copy the address in the message header into a browser it only brings me back to the pop up. It only pops up for this particular email account and not for any other ones installed.

I have tried changing the password through settings which hasn't made any difference. I can go into my account through a web browser which does not show any problems with external accounts.

I tried deleting the whole account line in password manager but this had again made no difference and I still got the pop up. I then deleted the whole account to re-install it again but it is failing to re-install as it gets stuck looking for the configuration settings and goes no further.

I have tried re-installing off line and it immediately finds the settings but I can't go any further as I need to be on line and to do that I therefore have to cancel the application.

Any help with this would be appreciated.

Regards JL
creator: uroneover

title: Emails disappearing at random
content:
Over the years, random emails seem to have occasionally disappeared from my inbox, though previously I have never been sure if I had somehow unwittingly deleted them. Yesterday, I looked for an email that contained a voucher code that was just over twelve months old, which I had "starred" and had been sitting at the top of my inbox. It was not there, despite it being present only a few days ago.

This morning, while browsing new emails, I hovered my cursor over a regular weekly newsletter, while pondering whether to read it. It disappeared before my eyes. I did not click on it to open it or anything. I have searched for these emails in the deleted folder and elsewhere - they are not to be found.

Emails do not seem to disappear when transferred to a sub-folder, only from the inbox.

Can someone explain how to recover them in non-technical language please? This is a POP3 account.

title: Intermittent "login to account <name> failed" for pop
content:
I've been getting a bunch of POP login fail dialogs from Thunderbird over the past couple of weeks (143.0.1, Windows 11). These seem to occur when the machine is idle and unattended. I will wake it up and see 40-50 of these dialogs stacked with the 'retry/enter new password/cancel' buttons. After hitting cancel on all of them, TB operates completely normally. The passwords are correct, and it sends and receives mail properly when it's being actively used. I have checked with my mail provider, and they see no signs of failed logins for my account in their server logs, which would seem to point the finger at TB.

This also just started happening yesterday on a different machine, same behavior but Win10.

Nothing has changed in months (aside from TB updates) the account and password remains the same, and is operating fine otherwise.

Help!

creator: txakura1

title: Chaos after last 2 updates
content:
The last two times Thunderbird installed updates there were serious issues.

The first one was 143.0.0? and what happened was that the Delete buttons stopped sending messages to Trash (even though there was a message in the bottom bar saying that it WAS sending to Trash. But it didn't.

I tried archiving lots of old messages, compacting mailboxes, etc. But all I was able to do was send them manually to Trash using a cumbersome process where I manually moved one message to trash and then used the right-click menu and chose "Send to Trash again". (The Send-to did not offer Trash as an option, including Send-to recent list).

Then it just updated to 143.0.1 and ALL MY MAILBOXES WERE GONE including the main mailbox for one of my accounts. I managed a weird workaround by recreating the account but now there are two mailboxes, one saying (POP) and one saying (IMAP) after them.

Issues:

I am not sure that I am getting all my messages from the server.

None of my mailbox subfolders are visible.

Noe of the filters are working, AFAIK. If some are, then the messages are not visible and mail is going into the ozone.

Sent To does not show any mailboxes either.

Believe me, I have tried as many workarounds as I can. I have some 35-plus years of Eudora/Thunderbird use and only recently have I regretted it.

Oh, yes, and this update reformatted menu bars which included removing the SEND button. Seriously?

I don't want to have to have programmer-level expertise to run Thunderbird. I don't want a fix that's full of acronyms and takes hours or days of fiddling about. I just want my Thunderbird to run reliably as it has (mostly) for years. I have chosen it as an alternative to Outlook and Gmail and the like, but recently, I'm pretty steamed that my choice of this independent option just causes me hours of (mostly fruitless) work.

Imma roll back to build 138.0.0 (because I found a Help answer about bad issues after updates and that was the build they went back to). I know it's old but it worked. ~CJD
creator: candas

Since yesterday it is again rebuilding the indexes of inbox, sent items and archive, and it is very slow. See screenshot. What should i do?
